item.title: Robin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Books make great gifts because they have whole worlds inside of them. And it's much cheaper to buy somebody a book than it is to buy them the whole world!" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Robin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description:
"Name the different kinds of people,’ said Miss Lupescu. ‘Now.’
Bod thought for a moment. ‘The living,’ he said. ‘Er. The dead.’ He stopped. Then, ‘... Cats?’ he offered, uncertainly." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Robin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "There's never been a true war that wasn't fought between two sets of people who were certain they were in the right. The really dangerous people believe they are doing whatever they are doing solely and only because it is without question the right thing to do. And that is what makes them dangerous." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Robin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Stories you read when you're the right age never quite leave you. You may forget who wrote them or what the story was called. Sometimes you'll forget precisely what happened, but if a story touches you it will stay with you, haunting the places in your mind that you rarely ever visit." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Robin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Librarians are the coolest people out there doing the hardest job out there on the frontlines. And every time I get to encounter or work with librarians, I'm always impressed by their sheer awesomeness." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Robin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Picking five favorite books is like picking the five body parts you'd most like not to lose." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Robin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "You don't get explanations in real life. You just get moments that are absolutely, utterly, inexplicably odd." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Robin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Rule number one: Don't fuck with librarians." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Robin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description:
"A book is a dream that you hold in your hands."
(As quoted on <a href="http://bookriot.com/2013/06/18/you-versus-a-blank-sheet-of-paper-gaiman-on-books-and-writing/">BookRiot</a>, June 18, 2013)" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Robin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fiction allows us to slide into these other heads, these other places, and look out through other eyes. And then in the tale we stop before we die, or we die vicariously and unharmed, and in the world beyond the tale we turn the page or close the book, and we resume our lives." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Robin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "One thing I've learned: you can know anything, it's all there, you just have to find it." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Robin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Children's fiction is the most important fiction of all." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Robin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "It's still National Library Week. You should be especially nice to a librarian today, or tomorrow. Sometime this week, anyway. Probably the librarians would like tea. Or chocolates. Or a reliable source of funding." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Robin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "May your coming year be filled with magic and dreams and good madness. I hope you read some fine books and kiss someone who thinks you're wonderful, and don't forget to make some art -- write or draw or build or sing or live as only you can. And I hope, somewhere in the next year, you surprise yourself." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Robin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Most people don't realize how important librarians are. I ran across a book recently which suggested that the peace and prosperity of a culture was solely related to how many librarians it contained. Possibly a slight overstatement. But a culture that doesn't value its librarians doesn't value ideas and without ideas, well, where are we?" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Robin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I would like to see anyone, prophet, king or God, convince a thousand cats to do the same thing at the same time." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Robin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Remember: that giants sleep too soundly; that witches are often betrayed by their appetites; dragons have one soft spot, somewhere, always; hearts can be well-hidden, and you can betray them with your tongue. (from "Instructions")" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Robin add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "It may help to understand human affairs to be clear that most of the great triumphs and tragedies of history are caused, not by people being fundamentally good or fundamentally bad, but by people being fundamentally people." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Robin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Robin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "God created war so that Americans would learn geography." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Robin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I haven't any right to criticize books, and I don't do it except when I hate them. I often want to criticize Jane Austen, but her books madden me so that I can't conceal my frenzy from the reader; and therefore I have to stop every time I begin. Every time I read Pride and Prejudice I want to dig her up and beat her over the skull with her own shin-bone." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Robin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Education: the path from cocky ignorance to miserable uncertainty." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Robin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Sometimes I wonder whether the world is being run by smart people who are putting us on or by imbeciles who really mean it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Robin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A person that started in to carry a cat home by the tail was gitting knowledge that was always going to be useful to him, and warn't ever going to grow dim or doubtful." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Robin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence; then success is sure. " -- Mark Twain

item.title: Robin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "In the first place God made idiots. This was for practice. Then he made school boards." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Robin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A home without a cat — and a well-fed, well-petted and properly revered cat — may be a perfect home, perhaps, but how can it prove title?" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Robin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Hain't we got all the fools in town on our side? And hain't that a big enough majority in any town?" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Robin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A cat is more intelligent than people believe, and can be taught any crime." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Robin add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Man is a Religious Animal. He is the only Religious Animal. He is the only animal that has the True Religion--several of them. He is the only animal that loves his neighbor as himself and cuts his throat if his theology isn't straight. He has made a graveyard of the globe in trying his honest best to smooth his brother's path to happiness and heaven....The higher animals have no religion. And we are told that they are going to be left out in the Hereafter. I wonder why? It seems questionable taste." -- Mark Twain
